.
Quarterly Reports Required for Improper Inspection or Disclosure of FTI
ROs are required to submit a quarterly report,
Improper Inspection or Disclosure of FTI
,
on the number of improper inspections or disclosures of FTI.  Quarterly reports are due 14 working days after the end of the following months:
March
June
September, and
December.
Reports are required in the following format:
file number
date the improper inspection or disclosure was discovered
number of FTI documents/records involved
date the improper inspection or disclosure was resolved
date TIGTA was contacted
date Office of Safeguards was contacted, and
point of contact (POC) for the improper inspection or disclosure.
Pension management centers (PMCs) must e-mail their reports to:
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F QUAL OVRST
.  Veterans Service Centers (VSCs) must e-mail their reports to:
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
.
Note
:
If a VSC/PMC had zero instances of improper inspections or disclosures for a particular quarter, then a negative response is required to the appropriate mailbox when the report is due.
